Sentencas: The sluggish oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) of cathode materials below 600 degrees C is one of the greatest obstacles to realizing the operation of low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (LT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, the ORR activity of rare earth-doped Ln(0.2)Ba(0.8)Co(0.7)Fe(0.3)O(3)
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: d (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) cathodes below 600 degrees C is significantly enhanced through the exsolution of highly active nanoparticles driven by applying a negative voltage of 2 V for 150 s. Pr0.2Ba0.8Co0.7Fe0.3O3-delta (PBCF) cathode exhibits an area-specific resistance of similar to 0.119 Omega cm(2) at 550 degrees C, approximately 1/3 of that for the pristine cathode (similar to 0.389 Omega cm(2)).
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Such improvement is ascribed to the the modification of its surface with high-density and small-size nanoparticles (CoO).
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the voltage-driven exsolution process can be manipulated by the surface oxygen vacancy concentration induced by rare earth doping.
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Compared with La- and Nd-doped cathodes, PBCF cathode has higher surface oxygen vacancy concentration, promoting the exsolution of Co in the bulk and resulting in the formation of higher density and smaller size nanoparticles.
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These enable the PBCF cathode to show the most significant improvement after treatment.
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This finding may provide a new strategy for the design of high-performance catalysts for LT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Manipulation of rare earth on voltage-driven in-situ exsolution process of perovskite cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
